channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024100561
item.description:
Report X-2024100561

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 1st, during the PM sort a package was found showing signs of leakage. The package contained UN1170, Ethanol solutions, 3, II. DG Admin i sunsure what exactly caused the leak. The package has been placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024100180
item.description:
Report E-2024100180

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ experienced a UN1824 Sodium Hydroxide Caustic Soda 50% release from (3) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor, a 15' x 15' area of the concrete lot below, and an 8' x 8' area of the concrete dock. The leaking drums were each placed into a 65-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were utilized to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100134
item.description:
Report E-2024100134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: FAIRVIEW
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 01:02 EST on 9/5, XPO-XCV contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "CARBOGUARD 893 - PART A" from 2x 5gal metal pails impacting the trailer floor. The pails were improperly loaded and damaged.. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor to assist. The terminal declined assistance and cleaned the spill with terminal-issued PPE. ERTS generated waste ID: 216957-1.
